title: 🧊 Failure to compile async function after moving from argument position `impl X` to `impl Supertrait`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code I can't share the full code at this time. Originally the code was like this ```Rust async fn f( hash: Hash, i: I sender: &mut impl TheTrait, ) -> Result, Error> { // snip Ok(xs) } ``` changing it to the following caused the ICE: ```Rust async fn f( hash: Hash, i: I sender: &mut S, ) -> Result, Error> where S: Supertrait, { // snip Ok(xs) } trait Supertrait: TheTrait {}; impl Supertrait for T where T: TheTrait {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: d5a82bbd26e1ad8b7401f6a718a9c57c96905483 commit-date: 2023-02-07 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.67.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace
